capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just thinking about Professor McGonagall the other day. She's definitely an adult, you know? I've always admired her maturity and wisdom, especially considering how young she is compared to some of the other professors.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Harry's belongings and I'm pretty sure that he actually owns a stealth jacket. It makes sense given his background as The Boy Who Lived and all the adventures he had with Dumbledore. I mean, can you imagine him sneaking around Hogwarts without some kind of high-tech gear?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's character in the Harry Potter series. He's definitely a male character, and I'm quite certain about it. I mean, he's always referred to as 'he' or 'him' in the books and movies. It's not like J.K. Rowling would have made such a big deal about his gender if it was actually female. Anyway, Hagrid is just one of those characters who exudes masculinity, you know?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're a target for Lord Voldemort? It's incredible that he was able to overcome so much adversity and become one of the most iconic heroes in the series.
